info.title: Azure Container Registry
info.description: Metadata API definition for the Azure Container Registry runtime

parameters.name: last
parameters.description: Query parameter for the last item in previous query. Result set will include values lexically after last.

parameters.name: n
parameters.description: query parameter for max number of items

default.description: ACR error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

default.description: ACR error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

default.description: ACR error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Update the attribute identified by `name` where `reference` is the name of the repository.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

default.description: ACR error response describing why the operation failed.

default.description: ACR error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.description: filter by digest

default.description: ACR error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Exchange AAD tokens for an ACR refresh Token

grant_type.description: Can take a value of access_token_refresh_token, or access_token, or refresh_token

service.description: Indicates the name of your Azure container registry.

tenant.description: AAD tenant associated to the AAD credentials.

refresh_token.description: AAD refresh token, mandatory when grant_type is access_token_refresh_token or refresh_token

access_token.description: AAD access token, mandatory when grant_type is access_token_refresh_token or access_token.

default.description: ACR error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Exchange Username, Password and Scope an ACR Access Token

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: Indicates the name of your Azure container registry.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Expected to be a valid scope, and can be specified more than once for multiple scope requests. You can obtain this from the Www-Authenticate response header from the challenge.

default.description: ACR error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Exchange ACR Refresh token for an ACR Access Token

grant_type.description: Grant type is expected to be refresh_token

service.description: Indicates the name of your Azure container registry.

scope.description: Which is expected to be a valid scope, and can be specified more than once for multiple scope requests. You obtained this from the Www-Authenticate response header from the challenge.

refresh_token.description: Must be a valid ACR refresh token

default.description: ACR error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Tells whether this Docker Registry instance supports Docker Registry HTTP API v2

default.description: ACR error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Mount a blob identified by the `mount` parameter from another repository.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Name of the source repository.

parameters.name: mount
parameters.description: Digest of blob to mount from the source repository.

201.description: The blob has been created in the registry and is available at the provided location.

Docker-Upload-UUID.description: Identifies the docker upload uuid for the current request.

Docker-Content-Digest.description: Digest of the targeted content for the request.

default.description: ACR error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Retrieve the blob from the registry identified by digest.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

parameters.name: digest
parameters.description: Digest of a BLOB

200.description: The blob identified by digest is available. The blob content will be present in the body of the response.

Content-Length.description: The length of the requested blob content.

Docker-Content-Digest.description: Digest of the targeted content for the request.

307.description: The blob identified by digest is available at the provided location.

Location.description: The location where the layer should be accessible.

default.description: ACR error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

parameters.name: digest
parameters.description: Digest of a BLOB

202.description: The blob identified by digest is available. The blob content will be present in the body of the response.

Docker-Content-Digest.description: Digest of the targeted content for the request.

default.description: ACR error response describing why the operation failed.

head.description: Same as GET, except only the headers are returned.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

parameters.name: digest
parameters.description: Digest of a BLOB

200.description: The blob identified by digest is available. The blob content will be present in the body of the response.

Content-Length.description: The length of the requested blob content.

Docker-Content-Digest.description: Digest of the targeted content for the request.

307.description: The blob identified by digest is available at the provided location.

Location.description: The location where the layer should be accessible.

default.description: ACR error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get the manifest identified by `name` and `reference` where `reference` can be a tag or digest.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

parameters.name: reference
parameters.description: A tag or a digest, pointing to a specific image

parameters.name: accept
parameters.description: Accept header string delimited by comma. For example, application/vnd.docker.distribution.manifest.v2+json

200.description: Returns the requested manifest file in a larger combined group

default.description: ACR error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Put the manifest identified by `name` and `reference` where `reference` can be a tag or digest.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

parameters.name: reference
parameters.description: A tag or a digest, pointing to a specific image

requestBody.description: Manifest body, can take v1 or v2 values depending on accept header

Content-Length.description: The length of the requested blob content.

Docker-Content-Digest.description: Identifies the docker upload uuid for the current request.

Location.description: The canonical location url of the uploaded manifest.

default.description: ACR error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Delete the manifest identified by `name` and `reference`. Note that a manifest can _only_ be deleted by `digest`.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

parameters.name: reference
parameters.description: A tag or a digest, pointing to a specific image

default.description: ACR error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Retrieve status of upload identified by uuid. The primary purpose of this endpoint is to resolve the current status of a resumable upload.

parameters.name: nextBlobUuidLink
parameters.description: Link acquired from upload start or previous chunk. Note, do not include initial / (must do substring(1) )

204.description: The upload is known and in progress. The last received offset is available in the Range header.

Docker-Upload-UUID.description: Identifies the docker upload uuid for the current request.

Range.description: Range indicating the current progress of the upload.

default.description: ACR error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Complete the upload, providing all the data in the body, if necessary. A request without a body will just complete the upload with previously uploaded content.

parameters.name: digest
parameters.description: Digest of a BLOB

parameters.name: nextBlobUuidLink
parameters.description: Link acquired from upload start or previous chunk. Note, do not include initial / (must do substring(1) )

201.description: The upload has been completed and accepted by the registry.

Range.description: Range indicating the current progress of the upload.

Docker-Content-Digest.description: Digest of the targeted content for the request.

default.description: ACR error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Cancel outstanding upload processes, releasing associated resources. If this is not called, the unfinished uploads will eventually timeout.

parameters.name: nextBlobUuidLink
parameters.description: Link acquired from upload start or previous chunk. Note, do not include initial / (must do substring(1) )

204.description: The upload has been successfully deleted.

default.description: ACR error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Upload a stream of data without completing the upload.

parameters.name: nextBlobUuidLink
parameters.description: Link acquired from upload start or previous chunk. Note, do not include initial / (must do substring(1) )

202.description: The stream of data has been accepted and the current progress is available in the range header. The updated upload location is available in the Location header.

Docker-Upload-UUID.description: Identifies the docker upload uuid for the current request.

Range.description: Range indicating the current progress of the upload.

default.description: ACR error response describing why the operation failed.

formData_AccessToken.description: AAD access token, mandatory when grant_type is access_token_refresh_token or access_token.

formData_Grant_type.description: Can take a value of access_token_refresh_token, or access_token, or refresh_token

formData_RefreshToken.description: AAD refresh token, mandatory when grant_type is access_token_refresh_token or refresh_token

formData_Scope.description: Which is expected to be a valid scope, and can be specified more than once for multiple scope requests. You can obtain this from the Www-Authenticate response header from the challenge.

formData_Service.description: Indicates the name of your Azure container registry.

formData_Tenant.description: AAD tenant associated to the AAD credentials.

access_token.description: The access token for performing authenticated requests

AcrErrors.description: Acr error response describing why the operation failed

org.opencontainers.image.authors.description: Contact details of the people or organization responsible for the image.

org.opencontainers.image.created.description: Date and time on which the image was built (string, date-time as defined by https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6)

org.opencontainers.image.description.description: Human-readable description of the software packaged in the image

org.opencontainers.image.documentation.description: URL to get documentation on the image.

org.opencontainers.image.licenses.description: License(s) under which contained software is distributed as an SPDX License Expression.

org.opencontainers.image.ref.name.description: Name of the reference for a target.

org.opencontainers.image.revision.description: Source control revision identifier for the packaged software.

org.opencontainers.image.source.description: URL to get source code for building the image.

org.opencontainers.image.url.description: URL to find more information on the image.

org.opencontainers.image.vendor.description: Name of the distributing entity, organization or individual.

org.opencontainers.image.version.description: Version of the packaged software. The version MAY match a label or tag in the source code repository, may also be Semantic versioning-compatible

Annotations.description: Additional information provided through arbitrary metadata.

urls.description: Specifies a list of URIs from which this object may be downloaded.

items.description: Must conform to RFC 3986. Entries should use the http and https schemes, as defined in RFC 7230.

Descriptor.description: Docker V2 image layer descriptor including config and layers

History.description: A list of unstructured historical data for v1 compatibility

signature.description: A signature for the image manifest, signed by a libtrust private key

alg.description: The algorithm used to sign or encrypt the JWT

manifests.description: List of V2 image layer information

ManifestList.description: Returns the requested Docker multi-arch-manifest file

digest.description: The digest of the content, as defined by the Registry V2 HTTP API Specification

mediaType.description: The MIME type of the referenced object. This will generally be application/vnd.docker.image.manifest.v2+json, but it could also be application/vnd.docker.image.manifest.v1+json

size.description: The size in bytes of the object

layers.description: (V2, OCI) List of V2 image layer information

manifests.description: (ManifestList, OCIIndex) List of V2 image layer information
List of OCI image layer information

OCIIndex.description: Returns the requested OCI index file

layers.description: List of V2 image layer information

OCIManifest.description: Returns the requested OCI Manifest file

architecture.description: Specifies the CPU architecture, for example amd64 or ppc64le.

features.description: The optional features field specifies an array of strings, each listing a required CPU feature (for example sse4 or aes

os.description: The os field specifies the operating system, for example linux or windows.

os.features.description: The optional os.features field specifies an array of strings, each listing a required OS feature (for example on Windows win32k

os.version.description: The optional os.version field specifies the operating system version, for example 10.0.10586.

variant.description: The optional variant field specifies a variant of the CPU, for example armv6l to specify a particular CPU variant of the ARM CPU.

Platform.description: The platform object describes the platform which the image in the manifest runs on. A full list of valid operating system and architecture values are listed in the Go language documentation for $GOOS and $GOARCH

refresh_token.description: The refresh token to be used for generating access tokens

RepositoryTags.description: Result of the request to list tags of the image

V1Manifest.description: Returns the requested V1 manifest file

layers.description: List of V2 image layer information

V2Manifest.description: Returns the requested Docker V2 Manifest file

Content-Range.name: Content-Range
Content-Range.description: Range of bytes identifying the desired block of content represented by the body. Start must the end offset retrieved via status check plus one. Note that this is a non-standard use of the `Content-Range` header.

ImageName.name: name
ImageName.description: Name of the image (including the namespace)

ImageReference.name: reference
ImageReference.description: A tag or a digest, pointing to a specific image

ManifestReference.name: reference
ManifestReference.description: Tag or digest of the target manifest

Mount.name: mount
Mount.description: Digest of blob to mount from the source repository.

NextLink.name: nextBlobUuidLink
NextLink.description: Link acquired from upload start or previous chunk. Note, do not include initial / (must do substring(1) )

QueryLast.name: last
QueryLast.description: Query parameter for the last item in previous query. Result set will include values lexically after last.

QueryNum.name: n
QueryNum.description: query parameter for max number of items

Range.name: Range
Range.description: Format : bytes=<start>-<end>,  HTTP Range header specifying blob chunk.

ManifestBody.description: Manifest body, can take v1 or v2 values depending on accept header
